Description: Set parameters for peak grouping using the xcms group.density method
minimum fraction of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group
bandwidth (standard deviation or half width at half maximum) of gaussian smoothing kernel to apply to the peak density chromatogram
width of overlapping m/z slices to use for reating peak density chromatograms and grouping peaks across samples
maximum number of groups to identify in a single m/z slice
minimum number of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

IMPORTANT! Do you want to use the sample grouping information provided in the File Grouping Table and conssider members of the same group as replicates? Otherwise, all files will be assigned a separate group (higher sensitivity, more noise, longer runtime)
